Results: Performance measures:
The MD Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI)

The MDASI evaluates the severity of 13 symptoms experienced by cancer patients (pain, fatigue, nausea, sleep disorders, distress, shortness of breath, difficulty in remembering, decreased appetite, drowsiness, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, numbness/breathing) at the scale of 0=symptom not present at 10=as bad as you can imagine. The severity score of symptoms ranging from 0 to 130 has been calculated. The MDASI also evaluates the amount of symptoms that interfere with 6 aspects of daily life: general activity, mood, work (including work in the home), relationships with other people, walking and enjoyment of life at the scale of 0=does not interfere completely with 10=interferred. The interference score ranging from 0 to 60 has been calculated.
The higher severity of symptoms and interference scores are a worse result.
